result.execSummary:
The defendant Shayla A. Pryor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shayla A. Pryor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shayla A. Pryor was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court will allow expunction.  However, deft will have to wait two yrs to request expunction.  She may write a letter to the Court requesting the expunction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayla A. Pryor

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Agreement
of DNA Collection at Conviction

Minutes:  10:47am.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Christopher Rose.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Cort.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  No restitution request has been made at this time.  Deft fined $500 plus costs.  60 DTP.  In default, 21 days work crew or 21 days KCJ.  DNA ordered.  Appeal rights.  Court will allow expunction.  However, deft will have to wait two years to request expunction.  She may write a letter to the Court requesting the expunction.
filed by Attorney Chris Rose
Fr: Court re: rotation.
Dates given at intake were not for ADA Huber's assigned weeks.  FPT/JS rescheduled to ADA Huber's assigned weeks
Jury selection on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling Order

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Christopher William Rose in court with Defendant Shayla A. Pryor.  Clerk: PT
  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over to Branch 3.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chris Rose.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 3/9/22 @ 900am.   Bond is continued.    jk

Defendant, Shayla A. Pryor, appeared.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
SPD has not secured representation
